boardgame.name: EastFront
boardgame.description: EastFront details the conflict between Germany and the Soviet Union during WWII. Players have to contend with production, supply, command control and whether to try and break the other sides' lines. Several scenarios cover every major point of the war. The game comes with a fantastic, detailed map of Eastern Europe and Russia printed on cardstock and many wooden blocks for the units. This is a standalone game that can also serve as one element of the complete EuroFront series which covers the entire European conflict of WWII._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;This title uses the Columbia Games Block system. While there are variations in the rule sets, all of the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Front_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; series of games are based on the block system. Basically this means that rather than using the traditional counters to represent units on the map the game uses wooden blocks that stand upright with unit details only shown on one side. This accomplishes two things: First it provides an easy way of producing a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;fog of war_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; because your opponent cannot tell, save through good memory or deduction, what type of unit a specific piece is or its current strength. Second, having the blocks stand on end allows the possibility of rotating a block so the current strength is the top number. Although most war games have some type of mechanism that allows units to take losses in steps of their overall strength, counters normally have at most two steps because they only have two sides. Blocks, however, have four so you can easily keep track of twice the amount of detail that many other war games provide._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;With the use of blocks, Columbia has provided a way of adding a good deal of depth to their war games without adding complex layers of bookkeeping, allowing interesting and relatively short sessions of play._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

1991 James F. Dunnigan Award for Playability _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Design Winner
1991 Origins Awards Best Modern-Day Boardgame Winner

CONDITION: 1st Edition, Brand new, in original shrinkwrap. POSTAGE COST: UK postage: £5.50 European Postage: £8.50 Rest of World Postage: £16.50 Any buyers in and around London are welcome to collect in person (cash on collection). COMBINED SHIPPING: I will always combine multiple items to reduce your shipping costs where possible. Please note that it is NOT always cheaper to combine shipping on games outside the UK due to the weight limit of 2KG on the Small Packet service. As a rough approximation, outside the UK it is usually cheaper to combine 5 or more games, while 4 or less are best sent individually. This depends entirely on the specific games - please contact me before buying if you wish to purchase multiple games so that I can give you an accurate shipping cost. ABOUT ME: I have been playing and collecting games for over 25 years and I also sell games and magazines on ebay with the same username (saabdastard) where I have a 100% positive rating and a feedback score of over 4000. I am a verified PAYPAL Premier account holder (since 2004), with over 650 PayPal Verified Buyers. SELLERS TERMS AND CONDITIONS: PAYMENT TERMS: Please wait until you receive my invoice before sending payment. Payment is due within 5 days of the date you receive my invoice. Please do not purchase if you do not intend to pay, or cannot pay within this time frame. PAYMENT METHODS: UK buyers may use PayPal, cheque or cash-on-collection. Overseas buyers MUST USE PAYPAL only. SHIPPING: Buyer is responsible for all shipping costs. Europe and Rest of World rates shown above are for Airmail. Surface Mail rate to Rest of World is available if you wish (same as Europe Air rate), but Surface Mail to Rest of World can take up to 2 months! There is no real difference between Air and Surface rates for Europe. INSURANCE: Insurance is optional on all items, unless noted. Failure to take out optional insurance limits my liability for loss or damage in the mail to the amount automatically covered by Royal Mail (currently £36 per package for Small Packets, £150 for International Standard). CUSTOMS: Buyers outside the EU are responsible for all Customs charges applicable to their country. RETURNS: New Unopened items may be returned for a refund of the purchase price of the item, excluding shipping charges, within 7 days of the delivery date. All returned items must be in the original packaging and in the condition that they were shipped to you. Defective or damaged items can be returned for an exchange or refund within 7 days of the delivery date. All returns require authorization from me BEFORE returning the item.

SHIPPING U.S. shipping will be via USPS Priority Shipping and based on a weight of 4 Lbs. International buyers are very welcome, but please contact me for a shipping price quote to avoid any surprises or misunderstandings. I will gladly combine shipping for multiple purchases. The final cost will be based on the total weight, but be aware that large packages that are shipped more than a certain distance accrue a large surcharge, so combining shipping may not save any money.

This is for the first edition - Version 3 which includes version 3 of the rules (copyright 2000) in the box. I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m not going to call this like new, because the labels have been applied. The game contents are in excellent condition and appear to be unplayed. I bought it secondhand, and never played it, just unfolded it and looked at the map. I checked it pretty carefully and cannot see any wear on any of the game contents. I checked the blocks and all the labels have been cleanly applied and and centered. There are 4 extra blocks 2 black and 2 red. The counters/markers are all crisp. There is tufting in the corner where they came out of the counter sheet. There is no marking or wear on the counters or the rulebook. The rulebook appears to be unread or very gently read. There is a second copy of the rulebook included. This has been 3 hole punched to go in a binder. The dice are not original There are four blue speckled dice, high quality, but not the originals (I checked against photos here). The game sleeve with the artwork has some rubbing wear, and light dirt marks. There are no tears or holes in the cover, just wear from sitting on a shelf. I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;d call the game sleeve very good, the generic black Columbia box has no wear and is in excellent condition. Summary: Game is complete. Contents unmarked _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; excellent, without wear. Dice are replacements. Box sleeve has noticeable whiting, and some dirt marks. Photos available upon request. International buyers welcome. This game weighs a little over 2 lbs, so it can go overseas first class rather than priority. US shipping will be via a priority flat rate box, unless you have a strong preference for parcel post.

Box is well worn. Blocks (x120, +4 blanks), counters (x60) and map (x1) are in good shape. The two summary sheets have some small notes on them. Also includes 4 orange dice and rulebook. Shipping is $12. Combine shipping rates are available when purchasing multiple items.
